post_text: It’s well known that food affects physical well-being. Now, new evidence finds that food also affects mood and mental well-being. To help students identify how certain foods can make them feel, Chartwells K12 is launching its next flagship program at The Meadows Elementary…Mood Boost! Students had the chance to sample a variety of food items including broccoli, carrots, and coleslaw.

shared_text:
DeSoto ISD added 2 new photos — at DeSoto High School.
December 2019 · DeSoto, TX ·

The DHS Culinary Program and the PTA in partnership with Texas Trust Credit Union hosted its first Chili Cook Off at DeSoto High School.
During the lunch hour, staff and community members were able to sample and vote on the best chili recipe for a small donation. Several DHS staff members were the unknown chefs who prepared some unique variations of this classic dish, such as spicy creole, alarm, all beef, all pork, with queso, etc. The favorite of them all was the spicy Creole version which had many requests for additional servings.

The event hostesses were truly grateful to the community donors who supported this effort, including Texas Trust Credit Union, Chicken Express DeSoto, On-Time Lending, Reppin’ My Kid Fanwear, ElstonAire and the DeSoto PTSA. The team is also appreciative of the uniquely designed trophies created
by the DHS Art students.

The proceeds will aid the current goals of both the DHS Culinary program and the PTA.

The gifted and talented referral period for Kindergarten students will begin on December 2, 2019. The referral period ends on December 10, 2019. Parents, guardians, teachers, students, administrators, and community stakeholders are welcome to refer kindergarten students who they believe will benefit from gifted and talented services. Referrals are only accepted online via the following link:
https://forms.gle/32LupHowwCbmq3yp6

post_text:
Seven students from the McCowan Middle School band have earned a placement in the Texas Music Educators Association All-Region Middle School Bands. These students competed against hundreds of students in their region in order to earn this very prestigious honor. The students competed to earn placement in one of three region bands. Two students earned a spot in the top band. Please join us in congratulating the following student-musicians:

Honors band:
Keira Justice-percussion
Deja Harris-clarinet

Symphonic band:
Ravion Miller-saxophone
Keyona Etier-trumpet
Jeremy Griffin-percussion

Concert band:
Arielle Holmes-trumpet
Aumiel Laws-percussion

-DHS senior Tiffany Kalu was recognized for receiving a full-ride scholarship to UT Austin.
-Recognized AP Teachers and students.
-Recognized Eagle Advantage Childcare Center receiving a 4-star rating.

shared_text:
DeSoto ISD added 69 new photos.
November 18, 2019 at 1:10 PM ·

Students from DeSoto High School had the opportunity to attend Senior Day at Prairie View A&M University on Saturday, November 16, 2019. Students visited various College majors based on their interest. Presentations were made to the students from various campus departments including Financial Aid, University Housing, Summer Bridge Programs, and Admissions. Students were given a tour of the campus, a presentation from the Prairie View "Marching Storm" Band, and attend the football game between Prairie View and Edwards Waters University. The trip was a co-sponsored event between Career and Technical Education (CTE), LETS Gear-Up and A2E2.

DeSoto ISD added 11 new photos.
November 15, 2019 at 1:13 PM ·

Did you know that paying attention in class can improve your cooking skills? Math concepts like counting, measurement, and fractions naturally unfold when navigating a recipe. Students at Katherine Johnson Technology Magnet Academy learn basic cooking skills and taste homemade recipes with the Chartwells K12 Discovery Kitchen. Just in time for the Holidays, students at Katherine Johnson TMA will be learned how to prepare a Cranberry Apple Relish! #YUM

post_text: Brian Beck-Smith teaches AP Calculus AB and AP Calculus BC at DeSoto High School. He enjoys teaching calculus because he wants students to understand rates of change and accumulation in the real world. Mr. Beck-Smith wants students to take AP Calculus in high school because it will help them prepare for college mathematics in STEM related fields like engineering and biology. Favorite quote: You learn more from failure than from success. #APWeek #WhyAP

post_text: Favorite Quote: We learn from our mistakes. Jo Nava is the AP 2-D Design and AP Drawing teacher at Desoto HS. She has taught art for 18 years, and this is her first-year teaching AP art. Mrs. Nava enjoys teaching AP art to help her students become a better artist by pushing them outside of their comfort zone and seeing their creativity blossom in their artwork. Students should take AP art if they are interested in pursuing a degree in the visual arts. #APWeek #WhyAP

Mrs. Nava enjoys teaching AP art to help her students become a better artist by pushing them outside of their comfort zone and seeing their creativity blossom in their artwork. Students should take AP art if they are interested in pursuing a degree in the visual arts. #APWeek #WhyAP

post_text: Marques D. Cameron Sr. is a History major and a proud Paul Quinn College Graduate. He’s been teaching for 7 years and has taught Advanced Placement courses for 2 years. Mr. Cameron is also the National Honor Society Adviser for the DeSoto High School Chapter. He currently teaches AP Government in the fall and AP Economics in the spring. Cameron enjoys AP courses because it allows him, as an educator, to go further into the information with students.

post_text: Due to a report of a gas smell at Curtistene S. McCowan Middle School today and out of an abundance of caution students and staff were evacuated from the building. The Glenn Heights emergency response team was on-site to assess the situation and worked with DeSoto ISD Plant Services to address the concern. Upon clearance from Glenn Heights authorities, students and staff returned to classes.
text: Due to a report of a gas smell at Curtistene S. McCowan Middle School today and out of an abundance of caution students and staff were evacuated from the building. The Glenn Heights emergency response team was on-site to assess the situation and worked with DeSoto ISD Plant Services to address the concern. Upon clearance from Glenn Heights authorities, students and staff returned to classes.

DeSoto ISD added 5 new photos — at DeSoto ISD.
November 14, 2019 at 10:31 AM · DeSoto, TX ·

Last evening, Superintendent Dr. D'Andre Weaver spent time sharing information, listening and gathering input from DeSoto ISD parents during the Parent Advisory Council meeting. In this session, the focus was on the "C" in the district's FOCUS Priorities, which deals with campus and classrooms. This discussion centered around Student Support Services and its structure to support the campus environment and the parent community.

post_text: Edgar F. Guerra is a 10th-year teacher of AP Spanish Language and Literature at DeSoto High School. He has been teaching at DeSoto High School for 12 years and enjoys teaching Spanish because he strongly believes that competence in more than one language is an essential part of communication and cultural understanding. In addition, Guerra believes that Spanish language and literature gives students the opportunity to sharpen their critical and analytical skills. Why should students take AP Spanish? He says, “students should take this course because it will help them gain insight on the many voices and cultures of the Spanish-speaking world. #APWeek #WhyAP

November 13, 2019 at 9:38 AM · DeSoto, TX ·

As a part of Advanced Placement Recognition week, DeSoto ISD parents and students attended an AP parent information meeting last evening. The parents were able to learn more about the DHS advanced placement programs and course offerings, the benefit of student enrollment and the importance of passing the AP exams. The attendees also enjoyed an innovative activity designed as a conversation starter about the rigor in an AP course. #EagleAP

post_text: First-year AP Music Theory teacher, Bryson Foster teachers at DeSoto High School. He enjoys teaching because it allows him to cover topics in more detail than it might be covered in other classes. Mr. Foster believes advanced placement courses are good for students because it not only educates the students at a different level but challenges and encourages them to do their very best. His favorite quote, “Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth” by John F. Kennedy. #APWeek

post_text:
Ms. Uchenna Nwaizu teaches AP World History at DeSoto High School. She enjoys teaching history because it is literally life. “History is a living, breathing entity, and it helps us to guide how we live and experience life every day. It's an honor to bring this topic to life for my students, and I hope they carry its importance with them for the rest of their lives” said Nwaizu.

Ms. Nwaizu’s favorite quote is "Go into the world and do well. But more importantly, go into the world and do good." - Minor Myers Jr. #APWeek

post_text: Meet AP Human Geography teacher, Oscar Robinson Jr at DeSoto High School. Mr. Robinson is currently in his first year of teaching an AP course and enjoys the learning process along with his students. He says that AP courses are great for students to take in high school to prepare them academically for the rigor of college courses. Students should take AP Human Geography to understand the relationship between people, places, and locations. There are a lot of things that geographers look at and use that are relevant to students in today’s society. #APWeek

post_text:
On October 14, district band members competed for placement in one of two DeSoto ISD Middle School All-District Honors Bands. Students earning placement in one of the bands participated in a two-day clinic under the direction of a guest conductor.

The event concluded with the All-District Middle School Band Concert on Saturday, October 19th in the DHS Auditorium, where students performed alongside students from each of the three district middle schools.

post_text: November 11-16 is Advanced Placement (AP) Week. We wanted to take a moment to highlight several of our AP teachers. Meet Mr. Tony Taylor, an AP Physics teacher at DeSoto High School. Mr. Taylor has taught AP for the last five years. He has a passion for giving students an appreciation for the numerous mathematical patterns of creation. Mr. Taylor believes that Physics can be best described as the “artwork of God.” It is an exposition on the mechanism of the Universe itself. His favorite quote is “The time is always right to do what is right” -Martin Luther King Jr.

shared_text:
DeSoto ISD added 21 new photos — at DeSoto High School.
November 8, 2019 at 5:29 PM · DeSoto, TX ·

DESOTO - The DeSoto Independent School District High School senior and top-ten student, Tiffany Kalu, received a wonderful surprise this morning. Kalu was the first student in the DFW area this year to receive a full ride scholarship to the University of Texas at Austin, a total of $96,000. The Office of Admissions and Cockrell School of Engineering staff walked in and surprised Tiffany in class . Her mom and sister were also on hand for the award.

Tiffany is a leader in her school and has worked really, really hard to prepare for her future. She was selected to receive the scholarship based on her class standing, having the highest reported SAT scores at DeSoto High School and for her participation in the Carnegie Mellon program this summer. She noted for being strong brilliant, balanced. She is a member of the DeSoto Eagles Marching Band and president of the Math Club.

DESOTO - The DeSoto Independent School District High School senior and top-ten student, Tiffany Kalu, received a wonderful surprise this morning. Kalu was the first student in the DFW area this year to receive a full ride scholarship to the University of Texas at Austin, a total of $96,000. The Office of Admissions and Cockrell School of Engineering staff walked in and surprised Tiffany in class . Her mom and sister were also on hand for the award.

Tiffany is a leader in her school and has worked really, really hard to prepare for her future. She was selected to receive the scholarship based on her class standing, having the highest reported SAT scores at DeSoto High School and for her participation in the Carnegie Mellon program this summer. She noted for being strong brilliant, balanced. She is a member of the DeSoto Eagles Marching Band and president of the Math Club.

shared_text:
DeSoto ISD added 30 new photos — at DeSoto High School.
November 8, 2019 at 5:15 PM · DeSoto, TX ·

DeSoto High School JROTC presented their annual Veterans Day Celebration at 9:30 am on Friday, November 8,2019, in the DeSoto High School Fred Nickels auditorium. This year they were joined by McCowan Middle School. "It is important for DHS to celebrate Veterans day to thank the many members of this great nation who have sacrificed so much," states JROTC leader LtCol Russell Hooper. "We must constantly be reminded of the fact that “freedom isn’t free”; many veterans who gave selflessly for our freedom, walk among us every day."

post_text:
It’s that time again, the annual Battle of Belt Line between our DeSoto Eagles and the Cedar Hill Longhorns! This year’s game is Thursday, November 7 at Longhorn stadium in Cedar Hill.

Eagle fans, we need you to purchase your tickets at the DeSoto Athletics office so our team gets credit for sales. Tickets are on sale now through Thursday at noon or until SOLD OUT, cash only. NO TICKETS WILL BE SOLD AT THE GATE!

Ticket prices: $3 for Students, $6 for adults.

No tickets purchased online will be accepted the DeSoto Visitors gate!

Please note: NO PASSES WILL BE ACCEPTED!
(This includes the 7-6A district pass, THSCA, TGCA, etc...)

CHISD Longhorn Stadium DOES have a BAG POLICY in place, much similar to ours. Complete details can be found at
https://www.chisd.net/tthl

shared_text:
DeSoto ISD added 9 new photos — with Genesis of Dallas at Frank D MoatesElementary.
November 1, 2019 at 4:18 PM · Glenn Heights, TX ·

Genesis of Dallas continues to salute DeSoto ISD Teachers of the Month with a 30-day free use of a new Genesis G-70! The Genesis G-70 is a 4-door compact executive sedan designed to compete with vehicles such as the Audi A4, the BMW 3 Series, Mercedes-Benz C-Class and Infiniti Q50.

This month’s school is Frank Moates Elementary and the teacher of the month is Mrs. Catherine Chavez Fields, a 5th grade bilingual teacher.

“If you visit her class, you will always find students working on projects and in stations. Students hold each other accountable for the work or task given; I've even witnessed where the students will get on disruptive students or remind students of the expectation or task given,” Principal Alexandra Barton referenced in the selection of Mrs. Chavez Fields.
Having served as a campus leader at Moates for the past 8 years, Mrs. Chavez Fields is excited to be selected as the Teacher of the Month!

post_text: AP Week is an opportunity for students and the greater DeSoto ISD community to learn about the benefits of Advanced Placement coursework. During AP Week, DeSoto High School plans to highlight AP teachers, host an AP Parent meeting, and finalize registration for AP exams. In addition, DeSoto High School is the host site for the NMSI AP Science Saturday Session on Saturday, November 16, 2019. This event is part of the NMSI College Readiness Grant and benefits DeSoto ISD, Cedar Hill ISD, and Duncanville ISD.

post_text:
During the DeSoto ISD school board meeting on October 28th, the District announced that DeSoto ISD Board Vice-President DeAndrea Fleming has been selected to participate in the Leadership TASB Class of 2020.

The DeSoto ISD Trustees honored its six-member Wipro Science Fellows 2019-2020 Cohort.

The trustees recognized our dedicated, hard-working principals to publicly celebrate the valuable work that they are doing on our campuses and in our district.

The Board also acknowledged that Texas Education Human Resources Day occurred in October and recognized our Human Resources staff with the reading of a proclamation from Governor Abbott.

Trustee Amanda Sargent announced the students that were selected to participate in the DeISD 2019-2020 School Board Fellows program. The following students were inducted during the school board meeting.

Click the link below to view board notes from the October 28th meeting.

http://www.desotoisd.org/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=22894427
